intro: Echites woodsonianus, commonly known as the Woodson's echites, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
